intro: Antidesma madagascariense var. madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical conditions and is often found in coastal forests or secondary vegetation. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
